column4: you probably want to change /etc/mplayer.conf; change the vo=x11 to vo=xv
sorry, it's /etc/mplayer/mplayer.conf
you mean visualboyadvance?
it's only an apt-get away :)
on the top menu bar: System-Admin->Synaptic. Once it's open type Ctl-F and search
have you enabled the multiverse repository?
and the universe?
there are several ways, the easiest for me is to ask you to type in a terminal   grep universe /etc/apt/sources.list , does that line have a # at the beginning?
herm, nm that's gonna be confusing :)
if you'd put a copy of your /etc/apt/sources.list on http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/
open /etc/apt/sources.list with the text editor under accessories; open http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/ in your browser and cut & paste. Give us the url when you're done
all the text in the editor into the box
you don't need to be able to write to it at this point
see gnomefreak :)
if everyone pasted stuff for us to see here, no one could read anything
ask again, we're scrolling fast
a background for grub you mean?

ok. To tell you the truth, that is very low on most peoples horizons. Booting only happens about once a week for most ubuntu users, and we only see it for a few seconds. To put it bluntly, we don't really care what the grub boot screen looks like as long as it works
then maybe you could look it up and write a wiki page ?
a design decision. Nothing more
if you have physical access (depending on the router) there should be a recessed button you can press to reset to defaults
heh.
